bropals.lib.simplegame.state

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • bropals.lib.simplegame.state.GameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, MouseListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EntityState, TestClass

    public abstract class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements MouseListener, KeyListener
    A class that is meant to hold code for a state in the game. Extend the class and implement all the code for that state of the game. To run the game state,

      Returns a reference to the AssetBank used by the GameStateRunner that is running this GameState.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the image with the specified key from this GameState's AssetBank. This is the same thing as doing getAssetManager().getAsset(key, BufferedImage.class)
        Parameters:
        key - the image key
        Returns:
        the image with the given key if it exists.

      • playSoundEffect

        public void playSoundEffect(java.lang.String key)
        Convenience method for playing a sound effect from this GameState's AssetBank. This is the same as doing getAssetManager().getAsset(key, SoundEffect.class).play()
        Parameters:
        key -

      • addController

        public void addController(Controller controller)
        Adds a controller to this GameState. Need to call super to the key and mouse input functions to make Controllers work.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller to add.

      • removeController

        public void removeController(Controller controller)
        Removes a controller from this GameState. Need to call super to the key and mouse input functions to make Controllers work.
        Parameters:
        controller - the controller to add.

      • key

        public void key(int keycode,
                boolean pressed)
        Description copied from interface: KeyListener
        Called when the game gets key input.
        Specified by:
        key in interface KeyListener
        Parameters:
        keycode - the key code. Use KeyCode
        pressed - whether or not the key was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.

      • mouse

        public void mouse(int mousebutton,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  boolean pressed)
        Description copied from interface: MouseListener
        Called when the game gets mouse button input.
        Specified by:
        mouse in interface MouseListener
        Parameters:
        mousebutton - the mouse button. Use MouseButton
        x - the x position the mouse pressed
        y - the y position the mouse pressed
        pressed - whether or not the mouse button was pressed or released. true for pressed, false for released.
